metadata.title: CVE-2022-35409 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in Mbed TLS before 2.28.1 and 3.x before 3.2.0. Insome configurations, an unauthenticated attacker can send an invalidClientHello message to a DTLS server that causes a heap-based bufferover-read of up to 255 bytes. This can cause a server crash or possiblyinformation disclosure based on error responses. Affected configurationshave MBEDTLS_SSL_DTLS_CLIENT_PORT_REUSE enabled andMBEDTLS_SSL_IN_CONTENT_LEN less than a threshold that depends on theconfiguration: 258 bytes if using mbedtls_ssl_cookie_check, and possibly upto 571 bytes with a custom cookie check function.

criterions.comment: mbedtls: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
